intro: Logania flaviflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered logania, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically ovate and arranged oppositely along the stem. The plant contains various alkaloids, which can be toxic to animals and humans if ingested.
